= Components =

|| *Component Code* || *Component Name* || *Function* || *Comments* ||
|| TGA.CR || Cerebellum || Motor coordination || ||
|| TGA.VTA || Ventral Tegmental Area || Respond to novel stimuli, unexpected rewards, and reward predictive sensory cues || ||
|| TGA.PAG || Periaqueductal Gray Matter || Descending modulation of pain and in defensive behaviour || ||
|| TGA.LC || Locus Coeruleus || Regulate the intensity of responses to salient stimuli || NE Source ||
|| TGA.RP || Raphe Nucleus || Regulate moods, temper anxiety, and relieve depression || Releases 3HT (serotonin) hormone (happiness) ||
|| TGA.RN || Red Nucleus || Motor coordination || Crawling of babies is controlled by TGA.RN ||
|| TGA.IO || Inferior Olivary Nucleus || Proprioception Relay from Spinal Cord to Cerebellum || ||
|| TGA.VN || Lateral Vestibular Nucleus || Postural Reflexes || ||
|| TGA.PPN || Pedunculopontine Nucleus || Providing sensory feedback to the cerebral cortex || ||
|| TGA.LTN || Laterodorsal Tegmental Nucleus || Modulating sustained attention or in mediating alerting responses || ||
|| TGA.PBN || Parabrachial Nucleus || Source of short-latency nociceptive input || ||
